074/**
075 *  The implementation of
076 *  {@link CodeBlock}
077 *  for a fragment of a {@code *.java} file.
078 *
079 *  @author Square,Inc.
080 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
081 *  @version $Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 943 2021-12-21 01:34:32Z tquadrat $
082 *  @since 0.0.5
083 *
084 *  @UMLGraph.link
085 */
086@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
087@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 943 2021-12-21 01:34:32Z tquadrat $" )
088@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
089public final class CodeBlockImpl implements CodeBlock
090{
091        /*---------------*\
092    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
093        \*---------------*/
094    /**
095     *  The implementation of
096     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.CodeBlock.Builder}
097     *  as the builder for a new
098     *  {@link CodeBlockImpl}
099     *  instance.
100     *
101     *  @author Square,Inc.
102     *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
103     *  @version $Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 943 2021-12-21 01:34:32Z tquadrat $
104     *  @since 0.0.5
105     *
106     *  @UMLGraph.link
107     */
108    @SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "OverlyComplexClass"} )
109    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 943 2021-12-21 01:34:32Z tquadrat $" )
110    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
111    public static final class BuilderImpl implements CodeBlock.Builder
112    {
113            /*------------*\
114        ====** Attributes **===================================================
115            \*------------*/
116        /**
117         *  The arguments.
118         */
119        private final Collection<Object> m_Args = new ArrayList<>();
120
121        /**
122         *  The reference to the factory.
123         */
124        @SuppressWarnings( "InstanceVariableOfConcreteClass" )
125        private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
126
127        /**
128         *  The format Strings.
129         */
130        private final List<String> m_FormatParts = new ArrayList<>();
131
132        /**
133         *  The static imports.
134         */
135        private final Collection<String> m_StaticImports = new TreeSet<>();
136
137            /*--------------*\
138        ====** Constructors **=================================================
139            \*--------------*/
140        /**
141         *  Creates a new {@code BuilderImpl} instance.
142         *
143         *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
144         *      builder instance.
145         */
146        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
147        public BuilderImpl( final JavaComposer composer )
148        {
149            m_Composer = requireNonNullArgument( composer, "composer" );
150        }   //  BuilderImpl()
151
152        /**
153         *  Creates a new {@code BuilderImpl} instance.
154         *
155         *  @param  composer    The reference to the factory that created this
156         *      builder instance.
157         *  @param  formatParts The format parts.
158         *  @param  args    The arguments.
159         */
160        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
161        public BuilderImpl( final JavaComposer composer, final List<String> formatParts, final List<Object> args )
162        {
163            this( composer );
164            m_FormatParts.addAll( requireNonNullArgument( formatParts, "formatParts" ) );
165            m_Args.addAll( requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ) );
166        }   //  BuilderImpl()
167
168            /*---------*\
169        ====** Methods **======================================================
170            \*---------*/
171        /**
172         *  {@inheritDoc}
173         */
174        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
175        @Override
176        public final BuilderImpl add( final CodeBlock codeBlock )
177        {
178            addDebug();
179            final var retValue = addWithoutDebugInfo( codeBlock );
180
181            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
182            return retValue;
183        }   //  add()
184
185        /**
186         *  Adds the given debug output.
187         *
188         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output.
189         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
190         *
191         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
192         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
193         */
194        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
195        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
196        public final BuilderImpl add( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput )
197        {
198            requireNonNullArgument( debugOutput, "debugOutput" ).ifPresent( v -> m_FormatParts.add( v.asComment() ) );
199
200            //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
201            return this;
202        }   //  add()
203
204        /**
205         *  {@inheritDoc}
206         *
207         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
208         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
209         */
210        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
211        @Override
212        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
213        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
214        public final BuilderImpl add( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
215        {
216            return add( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), format, args );
217        }   //  add()
218
219        /**
220         *  <p>{@summary Adds code with positional or relative arguments.}</p>
221         *  <p>Relative arguments map 1:1 with the placeholders in the format
222         *  string.</p>
223         *  <p>Positional arguments use an index after the placeholder to
224         *  identify which argument index to use. For example, for a literal to
225         *  reference the 3<sup>rd</sup> argument, use {@code "$3L"} (1 based
226         *  index).</p>
227         *  <p>Mixing relative and positional arguments in a call to add is
228         *  invalid and will result in an error.</p>
229         *
230         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
231         *      code.
232         *  @param  format  The format; may be empty.
233         *  @param  args    The arguments.
234         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
235         *
236         *  @since 0.0.6
237         *
238         *  @deprecated We do no longer expose the debug output generation.
239         */
240        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
241        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
242        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
243        public final BuilderImpl add( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
244        {
245            add( debugOutput );
246
247            var hasRelative = false;
248            var hasIndexed = false;
249            var relativeParameterCount = 0;
250
251            final var length = requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ).length();
252            final var indexedParameterCount = new int [requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).length];
253
254            ParseLoop:
255            //noinspection ForLoopWithMissingComponent
256            for( var pos = 0; pos < length; /* Update is inside the loop body */ )
257            {
258                if( format.charAt( pos ) != '$' )
259                {
260                    var nextPos = format.indexOf( '$', pos + 1 );
261                    if( nextPos == -1 ) nextPos = format.length();
262                    m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( pos, nextPos ) );
263                    pos = nextPos;
264                    continue ParseLoop;
265                }
266
267                //---* The update for the for-loop … *-------------------------
268                ++pos ; // '$'.
269
270                /*
271                 * Consume zero or more digits, leaving 'c' as the first
272                 * non-digit char after the '$'.
273                 */
274                final var indexStart = pos;
275                char c;
276                do
277                {
278                    checkState( pos < format.length(), () -> new ValidationException( format( "dangling format characters in '%s'", format ) ) );
279                    c = format.charAt( pos++ );
280                }
281                while( c >= '0' && c <= '9' );
282                final var indexEnd = pos - 1;
283
284                //---* If 'c' doesn't take an argument, we're done *-----------
285                if( isNoArgPlaceholder( c ) )
286                {
287                    checkState( indexStart == indexEnd, () -> new ValidationException( format( "$$, $>, $<, $[, $], $W, and $Z may not have an index" ) ) );
288                    m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
289                    continue ParseLoop;
290                }
291
292                /*
293                 * Find either the indexed argument, or the relative argument
294                 * (0-based).
295                 */
296                final int index;
297                if( indexStart < indexEnd )
298                {
299                    index = Integer.parseInt( format.substring( indexStart, indexEnd ) ) - 1;
300                    hasIndexed = true;
301                    if( args.length > 0 )
302                    {
303                        //---* modulo is needed, checked below anyway *--------
304                        ++indexedParameterCount [index % args.length];
305                    }
306                }
307                else
308                {
309                    index = relativeParameterCount++;
310                    hasRelative = true;
311                }
312
313                checkState( index >= 0 && index < args.length, () -> new ValidationException( format( "index %d for '%s' not in range (received %s arguments)", index + 1, format.substring( indexStart - 1, indexEnd + 1 ), args.length ) ) );
314                checkState( !hasIndexed || !hasRelative, () -> new ValidationException( format( "cannot mix indexed and positional parameters" ) ) );
315
316                addArgument( format, c, args [index] );
317
318                m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
319            }   //  ParseLoop:
320
321            if( hasRelative && (relativeParameterCount < args.length) )
322            {
323                throw new ValidationException( format( "unused arguments: expected %s, received %s", relativeParameterCount, args.length ) );
324            }
325            if( hasIndexed )
326            {
327                final Collection<String> unused = IntStream.range( 0, args.length )
328                    .filter( i -> indexedParameterCount[i] == 0 )
329                    .mapToObj( i -> "$" + (i + 1) )
330                    .collect( toList() );
331                final var s = unused.size() == 1 ? "" : "s";
332                if( !unused.isEmpty() )
333                {
334                    throw new ValidationException( format( "unused argument%s: %s", s, String.join( ", ", unused ) ) );
335                }
336            }
337
338            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
339            return this;
340        }   //  add()
341
342        /**
343         *  {@inheritDoc}
344         */
345        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
346        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
347        @Override
348        public final BuilderImpl add( final String format, final Object... args )
349        {
350            addDebug();
351
352            final var retValue = addWithoutDebugInfo( format, args );
353
354            //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
355            return retValue;
356        }   //  add()
357
358        /**
359         *  Adds the placeholder's argument.
360         *
361         *  @param  format  The format.
362         *  @param  placeholder The placeholder character.
363         *  @param  arg     The argument.
364         */
365        private final void addArgument( final String format, final char placeholder, final Object arg )
366        {
367            final var argument = switch( placeholder )
368            {
369                case 'N' -> argToName( arg );
370                case 'L' -> argToLiteral( arg );
371                case 'S' -> argToString( arg );
372                case 'T' -> argToType( arg );
373                default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException( String.format( "invalid format string: '%s'", format ) );
374            };
375            m_Args.add( argument );
376        }   //  addArgument()
377
378        /**
379         *  Adds debug output.
380         */
381        private final void addDebug()
382        {
383            createDebugOutput( m_Composer.addDebugOutput() )
384                .ifPresent( v -> m_FormatParts.add( v.asComment() ) );
385        }   //  addDebug()
386
387        /**
388         *  {@inheritDoc}
389         *
390         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
391         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
392         */
393        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
394        @Override
395        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
396        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
397        public final BuilderImpl addNamed( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String format, final Map<String,?> args )
398        {
399            return addNamed( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), format, args );
400        }   //  addNamed()
401
402        /**
403         *  <p>{@summary Adds code using named arguments.}</p>
404         *  <p>Named arguments specify their name after the '$' followed by a
405         *  colon {@code ":"} and the corresponding type character. Argument
406         *  names consist of characters in {@code a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and _} and
407         *  must start with a lowercase character.</p>
408         *  <p>For example, to refer to the type
409         *  {@link java.lang.Integer}
410         *  with the argument name {@code clazz} use a format string containing
411         *  {@code $clazz:T} and include the key {@code clazz} with value
412         *  {@code java.lang.Integer.class} in the argument map.</p>
413         *
414         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
415         *      code.
416         *  @param  format  The format.
417         *  @param  args    The arguments.
418         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
419         *
420         *  @since 0.0.6
421         *
422         *  @deprecated We do no longer expose the debug output generation.
423         */
424        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
425        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
426        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
427        public final BuilderImpl addNamed( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Map<String,?> args )
428        {
429            add( debugOutput );
430
431            for( final var argument : requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).keySet() )
432            {
433                checkState( LOWERCASE.matcher( argument ).matches(), () -> new ValidationException( format( "argument '%s' must start with a lowercase character", argument ) ) );
434            }
435            if( isNotEmpty( requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ) ) )
436            {
437                var p = 0;
438                ParseLoop: while( p < format.length() )
439                {
440                    final var nextP = format.indexOf( "$", p );
441                    if( nextP == -1 )
442                    {
443                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p ) );
444                        break ParseLoop;
445                    }
446
447                    if( p != nextP )
448                    {
449                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p, nextP ) );
450                        p = nextP;
451                    }
452
453                    Matcher matcher = null;
454                    final var colon = format.indexOf( ':', p );
455                    if( colon != -1 )
456                    {
457                        final var endIndex = min( colon + 2, format.length() );
458                        matcher = NAMED_ARGUMENT.matcher( format.substring( p, endIndex ) );
459                    }
460                    if( nonNull( matcher ) && matcher.lookingAt() )
461                    {
462                        final var argumentName = matcher.group( "argumentName" );
463                        checkState( args.containsKey( argumentName ), () -> new ValidationException( format( "Missing named argument for $%s", argumentName ) ) );
464                        final var formatChar = matcher.group( "typeChar" ).charAt( 0 );
465                        addArgument( format, formatChar, args.get( argumentName ) );
466                        m_FormatParts.add( "$" + formatChar );
467                        p += matcher.regionEnd();
468                    }
469                    else
470                    {
471                        checkState( p < format.length() - 1, () -> new ValidationException( format( "dangling $ at end" ) ) );
472                        if( !isNoArgPlaceholder( format.charAt( p + 1 ) ) )
473                        {
474                            throw new ValidationException( format( "unknown format $%s at %s in '%s'", format.charAt( p + 1 ), p + 1, format ) );
475                        }
476                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p, p + 2 ) );
477                        p += 2;
478                    }
479                }   //  ParseLoop:
480            }
481
482            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
483            return this;
484        }   //  addNamed()
485
486        /**
487         *  {@inheritDoc}
488         */
489        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
490        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
491        @Override
492        public final BuilderImpl addNamed( final String format, final Map<String,?> args )
493        {
494            addDebug();
495
496            for( final var argument : requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).keySet() )
497            {
498                checkState( LOWERCASE.matcher( argument ).matches(), () -> new ValidationException( format( "argument '%s' must start with a lowercase character", argument ) ) );
499            }
500            if( isNotEmpty( requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ) ) )
501            {
502                var p = 0;
503                ParseLoop: while( p < format.length() )
504                {
505                    final var nextP = format.indexOf( "$", p );
506                    if( nextP == -1 )
507                    {
508                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p ) );
509                        break ParseLoop;
510                    }
511
512                    if( p != nextP )
513                    {
514                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p, nextP ) );
515                        p = nextP;
516                    }
517
518                    Matcher matcher = null;
519                    final var colon = format.indexOf( ':', p );
520                    if( colon != -1 )
521                    {
522                        final var endIndex = min( colon + 2, format.length() );
523                        matcher = NAMED_ARGUMENT.matcher( format.substring( p, endIndex ) );
524                    }
525                    if( nonNull( matcher ) && matcher.lookingAt() )
526                    {
527                        final var argumentName = matcher.group( "argumentName" );
528                        checkState( args.containsKey( argumentName ), () -> new ValidationException( format( "Missing named argument for $%s", argumentName ) ) );
529                        final var formatChar = matcher.group( "typeChar" ).charAt( 0 );
530                        addArgument( format, formatChar, args.get( argumentName ) );
531                        m_FormatParts.add( "$" + formatChar );
532                        p += matcher.regionEnd();
533                    }
534                    else
535                    {
536                        checkState( p < format.length() - 1, () -> new ValidationException( format( "dangling $ at end" ) ) );
537                        if( !isNoArgPlaceholder( format.charAt( p + 1 ) ) )
538                        {
539                            throw new ValidationException( format( "unknown format $%s at %s in '%s'", format.charAt( p + 1 ), p + 1, format ) );
540                        }
541                        m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( p, p + 2 ) );
542                        p += 2;
543                    }
544                }   //  ParseLoop:
545            }
546
547            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
548            return this;
549        }   //  addNamed()
550
551        /**
552         *  {@inheritDoc}
553         */
554        @SuppressWarnings( "CastToConcreteClass" )
555        @Override
556        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final CodeBlock codeBlock )
557        {
558            addStatement( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, "$L", requireNonNullArgument( codeBlock, "codeBlock" ) );
559            m_StaticImports.addAll( ((CodeBlockImpl) codeBlock).getStaticImports() );
560
561            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
562            return this;
563        }   //  addStatement()
564
565        /**
566         *  {@inheritDoc}
567         *
568         *  @deprecated  Got obsolete with the introduction of
569         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
570         */
571        @SuppressWarnings( {"removal", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
572        @Override
573        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
574        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
575        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
576        {
577            return addStatement( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), format, args );
578        }   //  addStatement()
579
580        /**
581         *  <p>{@summary Adds a statement.}</p>
582         *  <p>Do not use this method when the resulting code should be used
583         *  as a field initializer. Use
584         *  {@link #add(String, Object...)}
585         *  instead.</p>
586         *
587         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
588         *      code.
589         *  @param  format  The format.
590         *  @param  args    The arguments.
591         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
592         *
593         *  @see org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.FieldSpec.Builder#initializer(CodeBlock)
594         *
595         *  @since 0.0.6
596         *
597         *  @deprecated We do no longer expose the debug output generation.
598         */
599        @Deprecated( since ="0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
600        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
601        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
602        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
603        {
604            return add( debugOutput, "$[" ).add( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, format, args ).add( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, ";\n$]" );
605        }   //  addStatement()
606
607        /**
608         *  {@inheritDoc}
609         */
610        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
611        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
612        @Override
613        public final BuilderImpl addStatement( final String format, final Object... args )
614        {
615            final var retValue = add( "$[" )
616                .addWithoutDebugInfo( format, args )
617                .addWithoutDebugInfo( ";\n$]" );
618
619            //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
620            return retValue;
621        }   //  addStatement()
622
623        /**
624         *  {@inheritDoc}
625         */
626        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
627        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
628        @Override
629        public final BuilderImpl addStaticImport( final Class<?> clazz, final String... names )
630        {
631            return addStaticImport( ClassNameImpl.from( clazz ), names );
632        }   //  addStaticImport()
633
634        /**
635         *  {@inheritDoc}
636         */
637        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
638        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
639        @Override
640        public final BuilderImpl addStaticImport( final ClassName className, final String... names )
641        {
642            final var canonicalName = requireNonNullArgument( className, "className" ).canonicalName();
643            for( final var name : requireValidNonNullArgument( names, "names", v -> v.length > 0, n -> format( "%s array is empty", n ) ) )
644            {
645                m_StaticImports.add(
646                    format(
647                        "%s.%s",
648                        canonicalName,
649                        requireValidArgument(
650                            name,
651                            "name",
652                            Objects::nonNull,
653                            $ -> format( "null entry in names array: %s", Arrays.toString( names ) )
654                        )
655                    )
656                );
657            }
658
659            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
660            return this;
661        }   //  addStaticImport()
662
663        /**
664         *  {@inheritDoc}
665         */
666        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
667        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
668        @Override
669        public final BuilderImpl addStaticImport( final Enum<?> constant )
670        {
671            return addStaticImport( ClassNameImpl.from( requireNonNullArgument( constant, "constant" ).getDeclaringClass() ), constant.name() );
672        }   //  addStaticImport()
673
674        /**
675         *  Adds a
676         *  {@link CodeBlock}
677         *  instance without prepending any debug output.
678         *
679         *  @param  codeBlock   The code block.
680         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
681         */
682        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "CastToConcreteClass"} )
683        public final BuilderImpl addWithoutDebugInfo( final CodeBlock codeBlock )
684        {
685            final var builder = (BuilderImpl) requireNonNullArgument( codeBlock, "codeBlock" )
686                .toBuilder();
687            m_FormatParts.addAll( builder.formatParts() );
688            m_Args.addAll( builder.args() );
689            m_StaticImports.addAll( ((CodeBlockImpl) codeBlock).getStaticImports() );
690
691            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
692            return this;
693        }   //  addWithoutDebugInfo()
694
695        /**
696         *  <p>{@summary Adds code with positional or relative arguments,
697         *  without prepending any debug output.}</p>
698         *  <p>Relative arguments map 1:1 with the placeholders in the format
699         *  string.</p>
700         *  <p>Positional arguments use an index after the placeholder to
701         *  identify which argument index to use. For example, for a literal to
702         *  reference the 3<sup>rd</sup> argument, use {@code "$3L"} (1 based
703         *  index).</p>
704         *  <p>Mixing relative and positional arguments in a call to add is
705         *  illegal and will result in an error.</p>
706         *
707         *  @param  format  The format; may be empty.
708         *  @param  args    The arguments.
709         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
710         */
711        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
712        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
713        public final BuilderImpl addWithoutDebugInfo( final String format, final Object... args )
714        {
715            var hasRelative = false;
716            var hasIndexed = false;
717            var relativeParameterCount = 0;
718
719            final var length = requireNonNullArgument( format, "format" ).length();
720            final var indexedParameterCount = new int [requireNonNullArgument( args, "args" ).length];
721
722            ParseLoop:
723            //noinspection ForLoopWithMissingComponent
724            for( var pos = 0; pos < length; /* Update is inside the loop body */ )
725            {
726                if( format.charAt( pos ) != '$' )
727                {
728                    var nextPos = format.indexOf( '$', pos + 1 );
729                    if( nextPos == -1 ) nextPos = format.length();
730                    m_FormatParts.add( format.substring( pos, nextPos ) );
731                    pos = nextPos;
732                    continue ParseLoop;
733                }
734
735                //---* The update for the for-loop … *-------------------------
736                ++pos ; // '$'.
737
738                /*
739                 * Consume zero or more digits, leaving 'c' as the first
740                 * non-digit char after the '$'.
741                 */
742                final var indexStart = pos;
743                char c;
744                do
745                {
746                    checkState( pos < format.length(), () -> new ValidationException( format( "dangling format characters in '%s'", format ) ) );
747                    c = format.charAt( pos++ );
748                }
749                while( c >= '0' && c <= '9' );
750                final var indexEnd = pos - 1;
751
752                //---* If 'c' doesn't take an argument, we're done *-----------
753                if( isNoArgPlaceholder( c ) )
754                {
755                    checkState( indexStart == indexEnd, () -> new ValidationException( format( "$$, $>, $<, $[, $], $W, and $Z may not have an index" ) ) );
756                    m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
757                    continue ParseLoop;
758                }
759
760                /*
761                 * Find either the indexed argument, or the relative argument
762                 * (0-based).
763                 */
764                final int index;
765                if( indexStart < indexEnd )
766                {
767                    index = Integer.parseInt( format.substring( indexStart, indexEnd ) ) - 1;
768                    hasIndexed = true;
769                    if( args.length > 0 )
770                    {
771                        //---* modulo is needed, checked below anyway *--------
772                        ++indexedParameterCount [index % args.length];
773                    }
774                }
775                else
776                {
777                    index = relativeParameterCount++;
778                    hasRelative = true;
779                }
780
781                checkState( index >= 0 && index < args.length, () -> new ValidationException( format( "index %d for '%s' not in range (received %s arguments)", index + 1, format.substring( indexStart - 1, indexEnd + 1 ), args.length ) ) );
782                checkState( !hasIndexed || !hasRelative, () -> new ValidationException( format( "cannot mix indexed and positional parameters" ) ) );
783
784                addArgument( format, c, args [index] );
785
786                m_FormatParts.add( "$" + c );
787            }   //  ParseLoop:
788
789            if( hasRelative && (relativeParameterCount < args.length) )
790            {
791                throw new ValidationException( format( "unused arguments: expected %s, received %s", relativeParameterCount, args.length ) );
792            }
793            if( hasIndexed )
794            {
795                final Collection<String> unused = IntStream.range( 0, args.length )
796                    .filter( i -> indexedParameterCount[i] == 0 )
797                    .mapToObj( i -> "$" + (i + 1) )
798                    .collect( toList() );
799                final var s = unused.size() == 1 ? "" : "s";
800                if( !unused.isEmpty() )
801                {
802                    throw new ValidationException( format( "unused argument%s: %s", s, String.join( ", ", unused ) ) );
803                }
804            }
805
806            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
807            return this;
808        }   //  addWithoutDebugInfo()
809
810        /**
811         *  Returns the arguments.
812         *
813         *  @return The arguments.
814         */
815        @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
816        public final List<Object> args() { return List.copyOf( m_Args ); }
817
818        /**
819         *  Returns the given object literally.
820         *
821         *  @param  o   The object.
822         *  @return The literal.
823         */
824        private static final Object argToLiteral( final Object o )
825        {
826            final var retValue = nonNull( o ) ? o : NULL_REFERENCE;
827
828            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
829            return retValue;
830        }   //  argToLiteral()
831
832        /**
833         *  Translates the given object to a name.
834         *
835         *  @param  o   The object.
836         *  @return The name.
837         */
838        @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks"} )
839        private static final Object argToName( final Object o )
840        {
841            final var retValue = switch( o )
842                {
843                    case CharSequence charSequence -> charSequence.toString();
844                    case ParameterSpec parameterSpec -> parameterSpec.name();
845                    case FieldSpec fieldSpec -> fieldSpec.name();
846                    case MethodSpec methodSpec -> methodSpec.name();
847                    case TypeSpec typeSpec ->
848                        /*
849                         * Does not work for anonymous types, so no check for the name
850                         * is required.
851                         */
852                        //noinspection OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent
853                        typeSpec.name().get();
854                    case null, default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException( "expected name but was " + o );
855                };
856
857            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
858            return retValue;
859        }   //  argToName()
860
861        /**
862         *  Translates the given object to a String.
863         *
864         *  @param  o   The object.
865         *  @return The resulting String, or
866         *      {@link Util#NULL_REFERENCE}
867         *      if the object is
868         *      {@code null}.
869         */
870        private static final Object argToString( final Object o )
871        {
872            final var retValue = isNull( o ) ? NULL_REFERENCE : Objects.toString( o );
873
874            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
875            return retValue;
876        }   //  argToString()
877
878        /**
879         *  Translates the given object to a type.
880         *
881         *  @param  o   The object.
882         *  @return The resulting type.
883         */
884        @SuppressWarnings( {"IfStatementWithTooManyBranches", "ChainOfInstanceofChecks", "InstanceofConcreteClass"} )
885        private static final TypeNameImpl argToType( final Object o )
886        {
887            final var retValue = switch( o )
888                {
889                    case TypeNameImpl typeName -> typeName;
890                    case TypeMirror typeMirror -> TypeNameImpl.from( typeMirror );
891                    case Element element -> TypeNameImpl.from( element.asType() );
892                    case Type type -> TypeNameImpl.from( type );
893                    case null, default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException( "expected type but was " + o );
894                };
895
896            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
897            return retValue;
898        }   //  argToType()
899

901         *  {@inheritDoc}
902         *
903         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
904         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
905         */
906        @SuppressWarnings( {"DeprecatedIsStillUsed", "removal", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
907        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
908        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
909        @Override
910        public final BuilderImpl beginControlFlow( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
911        {
912            return beginControlFlow( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), controlFlow, args );
913        }   //  beginControlFlow()

915        /**
916         *  Starts a control flow construct.
917         *
918         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
919         *      code.
920         *  @param  controlFlow The control flow construct and its code, such
921         *      as {@code if (foo == 5)}.<br>
922         *      <br>Shouldn't contain braces or newline characters.
923         *  @param  args    The arguments.
924         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
925         *
926         *  @since 0.0.6
927         *
928         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
929         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
930         */
931        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
932        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
933        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "DeprecatedIsStillUsed", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
934        public final BuilderImpl beginControlFlow( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
935        {
936            if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) ) )
937            {
938                add( debugOutput, controlFlow, args );
939                if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) add( " " );
940                add( "{\n" );
941            }
942            else
943            {
944                add( debugOutput, "{\n" );
945            }
946            indent();
947
948            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
949            return this;
950        }   //  beginControlFlow()
951
952        /**
953         *  {@inheritDoc}
954         */
955        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
956        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
957        @Override
958        public final BuilderImpl beginControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
959        {
960            addDebug();
961            if( isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) ) )
962            {
963                addWithoutDebugInfo( controlFlow, args );
964                if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) addWithoutDebugInfo( " " );
965            }
966            addWithoutDebugInfo( "{\n" );
967            indent();
968
969            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
970            return this;
971        }   //  beginControlFlow()
972
973        /**
974         *  {@inheritDoc}
975         */
976        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
977        @Override
978        public final CodeBlockImpl build() { return new CodeBlockImpl( this ); }
979
980        /**
981         *  {@inheritDoc}
982         */
983        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
984        @Override
985        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow()
986        {
987            addDebug();
988            unindent();
989            addWithoutDebugInfo( "}\n" );
990
991            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
992            return this;
993        }   //  endControlFlow()
994

996         *  {@inheritDoc}

1002        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1003        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1004        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1005        {
1006            return endControlFlow( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), controlFlow, args );
1007        }   //  endControlFlow()

1009        /**
1010         *  <p>{@summary Ends a control flow construct that was previously
1011         *  started with a call to
1012         *  {@link #beginControlFlow(String, Object...)}
1013         *  or
1014         *  {@link #beginControlFlow(boolean, String, Object...)}.}</p>
1015         *  <p>This form is only used for {@code do/while} control flows.</p>
1016         *
1017         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
1018         *      code.
1019         *  @param controlFlow  The optional control flow construct and its
1020         *      code, such as {@code while(foo == 20)}.
1021         *  @param  args    The arguments.
1022         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
1023         *
1024         *  @since 0.0.6
1025         *
1026         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1027         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1028         */
1029        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "DeprecatedIsStillUsed", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1030        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1031        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1032        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1033        {
1034            unindent();
1035            add( debugOutput, "} " + requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) + ";\n", args );
1036
1037            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1038            return this;
1039        }   //  endControlFlow()

1042         *  {@inheritDoc}
1043         */

1046        @Override
1047        public final BuilderImpl endControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1048        {
1049            addDebug();
1050            unindent();
1051            addWithoutDebugInfo( "} " + requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ) + ";\n", args );
1052
1053            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1054            return this;
1055        }   //  endControlFlow()

1075            return this;
1076        }   //  indent()

1078        /**
1079         *  {@inheritDoc}
1080         */
1081        @Override
1082        public final boolean isEmpty() { return m_FormatParts.isEmpty(); }
1083
1084        /**
1085         *  Checks whether the given placeholder character would expect an
1086         *  argument.
1087         *
1088         *  @param  placeholder The placeholder character.
1089         *  @return {@code true} if there is no argument expected,
1090         *      {@code false} otherwise.
1091         */
1092        private static final boolean isNoArgPlaceholder( final char placeholder )
1093        {
1094            final var retValue = IntStream.of( '$', '>', '<', '[', ']', 'W', 'Z' )
1095                .anyMatch( p -> p == placeholder );
1096
1097            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1098            return retValue;
1099        }   //  isNoArgPlaceholder()
1100
1101        /**
1102         *  {@inheritDoc}
1103         *
1104         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1105         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1106         */
1107        @SuppressWarnings( {"DeprecatedIsStillUsed", "removal", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1108        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1109        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1110        @Override
1111        public final BuilderImpl nextControlFlow( final boolean addDebugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1112        {
1113            return nextControlFlow( createDebugOutput( addDebugOutput, true ), controlFlow, args );
1114        }   //  nextControlFlow()
1115
1116        /**
1117         *  Adds another control flow construct to an already existing one.
1118         *
1119         *  @param  debugOutput The debug output that is added to the generated
1120         *      code.
1121         *  @param controlFlow  The control flow construct and its code, such
1122         *      as {@code else if (foo == 10)}.<br>
1123         *      <br>Shouldn't contain braces or newline characters.
1124         *  @param  args    The arguments.
1125         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
1126         *
1127         *  @since 0.0.6
1128         *
1129         *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1130         *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1131         */
1132        @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "DeprecatedIsStillUsed", "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1133        @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1134        @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1135        public final BuilderImpl nextControlFlow( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1136        {
1137            unindent();
1138            add( "}" );
1139            if( !requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ).startsWith( "\n" ) ) add( " " );
1140            add( debugOutput, controlFlow, args );
1141            if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) add(" " );
1142            add( "{\n" );
1143            indent();
1144
1145            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1146            return this;
1147        }   //  nextControlFlow()
1148
1149        /**
1150         *  {@inheritDoc}
1151         */
1152        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1153        @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
1154        @Override
1155        public final BuilderImpl nextControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args )
1156        {
1157            unindent();
1158            addWithoutDebugInfo( "}" );
1159            if( !requireNonNullArgument( controlFlow, "controlFlow" ).startsWith( "\n" ) ) addWithoutDebugInfo( " " );
1160            add( controlFlow, args );
1161            if( !controlFlow.endsWith( "\n" ) ) addWithoutDebugInfo(" " );
1162            addWithoutDebugInfo( "{\n" );
1163            indent();
1164
1165            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1166            return this;
1167        }   //  nextControlFlow()
1168
1169        /**
1170         *  {@inheritDoc}
1171         */
1172        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1173        @Override
1174        public final BuilderImpl unindent()
1175        {
1176            m_FormatParts.add( "$<" );
1177
1178            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1179            return this;
1180        }   //  unindent()
1181    }

1184    /**
1185     *  A helper class that supports to join code blocks.
1186     *
1187     *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
1188     *  @version $Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 943 2021-12-21 01:34:32Z tquadrat $
1189     *  @since 0.0.5
1190     *
1191     *  @UMLGraph.link
1192     */
1193    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CodeBlockImpl.java 943 2021-12-21 01:34:32Z tquadrat $" )
1194    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
1195    private static final class CodeBlockJoiner
1196    {
1197            /*------------*\
1198        ====** Attributes **===================================================
1199            \*------------*/
1200        /**
1201         *  The builder that is used to deliver the final code block.
1202         */
1203        @SuppressWarnings( "InstanceVariableOfConcreteClass" )
1204        private final BuilderImpl m_Builder;
1205
1206        /**
1207         *  The separator for the joined code blocks.
1208         */
1209        private final String m_Delimiter;
1210
1211        /**
1212         *  Flag that indicates whether to add the delimiter on adding a new
1213         *  code block.
1214         */
1215        private boolean m_First = true;
1216
1217            /*--------------*\
1218        ====** Constructors **=================================================
1219            \*--------------*/
1220        /**
1221         *  Creates a new {@code CodeBlockJoiner} instance.
1222         *
1223         *  @param  delimiter   The separator for the joined code blocks.
1224         *  @param  builder The builder that is used to deliver the final code
1225         *      block.
1226         */
1227        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1228        public CodeBlockJoiner( final String delimiter, final BuilderImpl builder )
1229        {
1230            m_Delimiter = requireNonNullArgument( delimiter, "delimiter" );
1231            m_Builder = requireNonNullArgument( builder, "builder" );
1232        }   //  CodeBlockJoiner()
1233
1234            /*---------*\
1235        ====** Methods **======================================================
1236            \*---------*/
1237        /**
1238         *  Adds another code block.
1239         *
1240         *  @param  codeBlock   The new code block.
1241         *  @return This {@code CodeBlockJoiner} instance.
1242         */
1243        @SuppressWarnings( {"TypeMayBeWeakened", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1244        public final CodeBlockJoiner add( final CodeBlockImpl codeBlock )
1245        {
1246            if( !m_First ) m_Builder.addWithoutDebugInfo( m_Delimiter );
1247            m_First = false;
1248
1249            m_Builder.add( codeBlock );
1250
1251            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1252            return this;
1253        }   //  add()
1254
1255        /**
1256         *  Returns the new code block with the joined ones.
1257         *
1258         *  @return The new code block.
1259         */
1260        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1261        public final CodeBlockImpl join() { return m_Builder.build(); }
1262
1263        /**
1264         *  Merges this code block joiner with the given other one.
1265         *
1266         *  @param  other   The other code block joiner.
1267         *  @return This {@code CodeBlockJoiner} instance.
1268         */
1269        @SuppressWarnings( {"AccessingNonPublicFieldOfAnotherObject", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1270        public final CodeBlockJoiner merge( final CodeBlockJoiner other )
1271        {
1272            final var otherBlock = requireNonNullArgument( other, "other" ).m_Builder.build();
1273            if( !otherBlock.isEmpty() ) add( otherBlock );
1274
1275            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
1276            return this;
1277        }   //  merge()
1278    }
1279    //  class CodeBlockJoiner
1280
1281        /*------------*\
1282    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
1283        \*------------*/
1284    /**
1285     *  The arguments.
1286     */
1287    private final List<Object> m_Args;
1288
1289    /**
1290     *  Lazily initialised return value of
1291     *  {@link #toString()}
1292     *  for this code block.
1293     */
1294    private final Lazy<String> m_CachedString;
1295
1296    /**
1297     *  The reference to the factory.
1298     */
1299    @SuppressWarnings( "InstanceVariableOfConcreteClass" )
1300    private final JavaComposer m_Composer;
1301
1302    /**
1303     *  A heterogeneous list containing string literals and value placeholders.
1304     */
1305    private final List<String> m_FormatParts;
1306
1307    /**
1308     *  The static imports.
1309     */
1310    private final Set<String> m_StaticImports;
1311
1312        /*------------------------*\
1313    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
1314        \*------------------------*/
1315    /**
1316     *  The regular expression that is used to determine whether a parameter
1317     *  name starts with a lowercase character.
1318     */
1319    public static final Pattern LOWERCASE;
1320
1321    /**
1322     *  The regular expression that is used to obtain the argument name from
1323     *  a format string.
1324     */
1325    public static final Pattern NAMED_ARGUMENT;
1326
1327    static
1328    {
1329        try
1330        {
1331            LOWERCASE = Pattern.compile( "[a-z]+[\\w_]*" );
1332            NAMED_ARGUMENT = Pattern.compile( "\\$(?<argumentName>[\\w_]+):(?<typeChar>[\\w]).*" );
1333        }
1334        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
1335        {
1336            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError( e );
1337        }
1338    }
1339
1340        /*--------------*\
1341    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
1342        \*--------------*/
1343    /**
1344     *  Creates a new {@code CodeBlockImpl} instance.
1345     *
1346     *  @param  builder The builder for this instance.
1347     */
1348    @SuppressWarnings( {"AccessingNonPublicFieldOfAnotherObject", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1349    public CodeBlockImpl( final BuilderImpl builder )
1350    {
1351        m_Composer = builder.m_Composer;
1352        m_FormatParts = builder.formatParts();
1353        m_Args = builder.args();
1354        m_StaticImports = Set.copyOf( builder.m_StaticImports );
1355
1356        m_CachedString = Lazy.use( this::initialiseCachedString );
1357    }   //  CodeBlockImpl()
1358
1359        /*---------*\
1360    ====** Methods **==========================================================
1361        \*---------*/
1362    /**
1363     *  Returns the arguments.
1364     *
1365     *  @return The arguments.
1366     */
1367    /*
1368     * Originally, this was the reference to the internal collection!
1369     */
1370    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1371    public final List<Object> args() { return List.copyOf( m_Args ); }
1372
1373    /**
1374     *  Creates a builder for an instance of {@code CodeBlock}.
1375     *
1376     *  @return The new builder.
1377     *
1378     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1379     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1380     */
1381    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1382    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1383    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1384    public static BuilderImpl builder() { return new BuilderImpl( new JavaComposer() ); }
1385
1386    /**
1387     *  {@inheritDoc}
1388     */
1389    @Override
1390    public final boolean equals( final Object o )
1391    {
1392        var retValue = this == o;
1393        if( !retValue && (o instanceof CodeBlockImpl other) )
1394        {
1395            retValue = m_Composer.equals( other.m_Composer ) && toString().equals( o.toString() );
1396        }
1397
1398        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1399        return retValue;
1400    }   //  equals()
1401
1402    /**
1403     *  Returns the format parts from this code block.
1404     *
1405     *  @return The format parts.
1406     */
1407    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1408    public final List<String> formatParts() { return List.copyOf( m_FormatParts ); }
1409

1411     *  Returns the
1412     *  {@link JavaComposer}
1413     *  factory.
1414     *
1415     *  @return The reference to the factory.
1416     */
1417    @SuppressWarnings( {"PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1418    public final JavaComposer getFactory() { return m_Composer; }

1420    /**
1421     *  Returns the static imports for this code block.
1422     *
1423     *  @return The static imports.
1424     */
1425    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1426    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
1427    public final Set<String> getStaticImports() { return m_StaticImports; }
1428
1429    /**
1430     *  {@inheritDoc}
1431     */
1432    @Override
1433    public final int hashCode() { return toString().hashCode(); }
1434
1435    /**
1436     *  The initializer for
1437     *  {@link #m_CachedString}.
1438     *
1439     *  @return The return value for
1440     *      {@link #toString()}.
1441     */
1442    private final String initialiseCachedString()
1443    {
1444        final var resultBuilder = new StringBuilder();
1445        final var codeWriter = new CodeWriter( m_Composer, resultBuilder );
1446        try
1447        {
1448            codeWriter.emit( this );
1449        }
1450        catch( final UncheckedIOException e )
1451        {
1452            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e.getCause() );
1453        }
1454        final var retValue = resultBuilder.toString();
1455
1456        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1457        return retValue;
1458    }   //  initialiseCachedString()
1459
1460    /**
1461     *  {@inheritDoc}
1462     */
1463    @Override
1464    public final boolean isEmpty() { return m_FormatParts.isEmpty(); }
1465
1466    /**
1467     * {@inheritDoc}
1468     */
1469    @Override
1470    public final CodeBlock join( final String separator, final CodeBlock... codeBlocks )
1471    {
1472        final var retValue = makeCodeBlockStream( this, requireNonNullArgument( codeBlocks, "codeBlocks" ) )
1473            .collect( joining( separator ) );
1474
1475        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1476        return retValue;
1477    }   //  join()
1478
1479    /**
1480     * <p>{@summary Joins this code block with the given code blocks into a
1481     * single new {@code CodeBlock} instance, each separated by the given
1482     * separator.} The given prefix will be prepended to the new
1483     * {@code CodeBloc}, and the given suffix will be appended to it.</p>
1484     * <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1485     * &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1486     * &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1487     * &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1488     *
1489     * @param separator The separator.
1490     * @param prefix The prefix.
1491     * @param suffix The suffix.
1492     * @param codeBlocks The code blocks to join.
1493     * @return The new code block.
1494     */
1495    @Override
1496    public final CodeBlock join( final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix, final CodeBlock... codeBlocks )
1497    {
1498        final var retValue = makeCodeBlockStream( this, requireNonNullArgument( codeBlocks, "codeBlocks" ) )
1499            .collect( joining( separator, prefix, suffix ) );
1500
1501        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1502        return retValue;
1503    }   //  join()
1504
1505    /**
1506     *  <p>{@summary Joins the given code blocks into a single
1507     *  {@code CodeBlockImpl} instance, each separated the given
1508     *  separator.}</p>
1509     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1510     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1511     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1512     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1513     *
1514     *  @param  codeBlocks  The code blocks to join.
1515     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1516     *  @return The new code block.
1517     *
1518     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1519     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1520     */
1521    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1522    @SuppressWarnings( "CastToConcreteClass" )
1523    public static final CodeBlockImpl join( final Iterable<CodeBlock> codeBlocks, final String separator )
1524    {
1525        final var retValue = StreamSupport.stream( codeBlocks.spliterator(), false )
1526            .map( c -> (CodeBlockImpl) c )
1527            .collect( joiningStatic( separator ) );
1528
1529        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1530        return retValue;
1531    }   //  join()
1532
1533    /**
1534     *  <p>{@summary Joins the given code blocks into a single
1535     *  {@code CodeBlock} instance, each separated the given separator. The
1536     *  given prefix will be prepended to the new {@code CodeBloc}, and the
1537     *  given suffix will be appended to it.}</p>
1538     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1539     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1540     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1541     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1542     *
1543     *  @param  codeBlocks  The code blocks to join.
1544     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1545     *  @param  prefix  The prefix.
1546     *  @param  suffix  The suffix.
1547     *  @return The new code block.
1548     *
1549     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1550     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1551     */
1552    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1553    @SuppressWarnings( "CastToConcreteClass" )
1554    public static CodeBlockImpl join( final Iterable<CodeBlock> codeBlocks, final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix  )
1555    {
1556        final var retValue = StreamSupport.stream( codeBlocks.spliterator(), false )
1557            .map( c -> (CodeBlockImpl) c )
1558            .collect( joiningStatic( separator, prefix, suffix ) );
1559
1560        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1561        return retValue;
1562    }   //  join()
1563
1564    /**
1565     *  <p>{@summary A
1566     *  {@link Collector}
1567     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1568     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.}</p>
1569     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1570     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1571     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1572     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1573     *
1574     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1575     *  @return The new collector.
1576     */
1577    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1578    public final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joining( final String separator )
1579    {
1580        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1581        (
1582            () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, new BuilderImpl( m_Composer ) ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, CodeBlockJoiner::join
1583        );
1584
1585        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1586        return retValue;
1587    }   //  joining()
1588
1589    /**
1590     *  <p>{@summary A
1591     *  {@link Collector}
1592     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1593     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.} The given prefix
1594     *  will be prepended to the new {@code CodeBloc}, and the given suffix
1595     *  will be appended to it.</p>
1596     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1597     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1598     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator, and
1599     *  &quot;{@code int func( }&quot; as the prefix and &quot; {@code )}&quot;
1600     *  as the suffix respectively would produce
1601     *  &quot;{@code int func( String s, Object o, int i )}&quot;.</p>
1602     *
1603     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1604     *  @param  prefix  The prefix.
1605     *  @param  suffix  The suffix.
1606     *  @return The new collector.
1607     */
1608    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicMethodNotExposedInInterface" )
1609    public final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joining( final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix )
1610    {
1611        final var builder = new BuilderImpl( m_Composer );
1612        builder.add( "$N", prefix );
1613        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1614        (
1615            () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, builder ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, joiner ->
1616            {
1617                builder.add( m_Composer.codeBlockOf( "$N", suffix ) );
1618                return joiner.join();
1619            }
1620        );
1621
1622        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1623        return retValue;
1624    }   //  joining()
1625
1626    /**
1627     *  <p>{@summary A
1628     *  {@link Collector}
1629     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1630     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.}</p>
1631     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1632     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1633     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator would produce
1634     *  &quot;{@code String s, Object o, int i}&quot;.</p>
1635     *
1636     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1637     *  @return The new collector.
1638     *
1639     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1640     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1641     */
1642    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1643    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1644    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1645    public static final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joiningStatic( final String separator )
1646    {
1647        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1648            (
1649                () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, new BuilderImpl( new JavaComposer() ) ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, CodeBlockJoiner::join
1650            );
1651
1652        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1653        return retValue;
1654    }   //  joiningStatic()
1655
1656    /**
1657     *  <p>{@summary A
1658     *  {@link Collector}
1659     *  implementation that joins {@code CodeBlock} instances together into one
1660     *  new code block, separated by the given separator.} The given prefix
1661     *  will be prepended to the new {@code CodeBloc}, and the given suffix
1662     *  will be appended to it.</p>
1663     *  <p>For example, joining &quot;{@code String s}&quot;,
1664     *  &quot;{@code Object o}&quot; and &quot;{@code int i}&quot; using
1665     *  &quot;{@code , }&quot; as the separator, and
1666     *  &quot;{@code int func( }&quot; as the prefix and &quot; {@code )}&quot;
1667     *  as the suffix respectively would produce
1668     *  &quot;{@code int func( String s, Object o, int i )}&quot;.</p>
1669     *
1670     *  @param  separator   The separator.
1671     *  @param  prefix  The prefix.
1672     *  @param  suffix  The suffix.
1673     *  @return The new collector.
1674     *
1675     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1676     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1677     */
1678    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
1679    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1680    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
1681    public static final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> joiningStatic( final String separator, final String prefix, final String suffix )
1682    {
1683        final var composer = new JavaComposer();
1684        final var builder = new BuilderImpl( composer );
1685        builder.add( "$N", prefix );
1686        final Collector<CodeBlockImpl,?,CodeBlockImpl> retValue = Collector.of
1687            (
1688                () -> new CodeBlockJoiner( separator, builder ), CodeBlockJoiner::add, CodeBlockJoiner::merge, joiner ->
1689                {
1690                    builder.add( composer.codeBlockOf( "$N", suffix ) );
1691                    return joiner.join();
1692                }
1693            );
1694
1695        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1696        return retValue;
1697    }   //  joiningStatic()
1698
1699    /**
1700     *  Composes a stream from the given {@code CodeBlock} instances.
1701     *
1702     *  @param  head    The first code block.
1703     *  @param  tail    The other code blocks.
1704     *  @return The
1705     *      {@link Stream}
1706     *      instance with the {@code CodeBlock} instances.
1707     */
1708    @SuppressWarnings( "CastToConcreteClass" )
1709    private static final Stream<CodeBlockImpl> makeCodeBlockStream( final CodeBlock head, final CodeBlock... tail )
1710    {
1711        final var builder = Stream.<CodeBlockImpl>builder();
1712        builder.add( (CodeBlockImpl) requireNonNullArgument( head, "head" ) );
1713        for( final var block : requireNonNullArgument( tail, "tail" ) )
1714        {
1715            builder.add( (CodeBlockImpl) block );
1716        }
1717        final var retValue = builder.build();
1718
1719        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1720        return retValue;
1721    }   //  makeCodeBlockStream()
1722
1723    /**
1724     *  Creates a new {@code CodeBlock} instance from the given format and
1725     *  arguments.
1726     *
1727     *  @param  format  The format.
1728     *  @param  args    The arguments.
1729     *  @return The new code block.
1730     *

1732     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1733     */
1734    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
1735    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1736    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1737    public static final CodeBlockImpl of( final String format, final Object... args )
1738    {
1739        final var retValue = of( NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT, format, args );
1740
1741        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1742        return retValue;
1743    }   //  of()
1744
1745    /**
1746     *  Creates a new {@code CodeBlock} instance from the given format and
1747     *  arguments, and adds the given debug output if any.
1748     *
1749     *  @param  debugOutput The debug output.
1750     *  @param  format  The format.
1751     *  @param  args    The arguments.
1752     *  @return The new code block.
1753     *
1754     *  @since 0.0.6
1755     *
1756     *  @deprecated Got obsolete with the introduction of
1757     *      {@link JavaComposer}.
1758     */
1759    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
1760    @SuppressWarnings( {"OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1761    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.6" )
1762    public static final CodeBlockImpl of( final Optional<DebugOutput> debugOutput, final String format, final Object... args )
1763    {
1764        final var retValue = builder().add( requireNonNullArgument( debugOutput, "debugOutput" ), format, args ).build();
1765
1766        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1767        return retValue;
1768    }   //  of()
1769
1770    /**
1771     *  Creates a new builder that is initialised with the components of this
1772     *  code block.
1773     *
1774     *  @return The new builder.
1775     */
1776    @SuppressWarnings( {"AccessingNonPublicFieldOfAnotherObject", "UseOfConcreteClass"} )
1777    @Override
1778    public final BuilderImpl toBuilder()
1779    {
1780        final var retValue = new BuilderImpl( m_Composer, m_FormatParts, m_Args );
1781        retValue.m_StaticImports.addAll( m_StaticImports );
1782
1783        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
1784        return retValue;
1785    }   //  toBuilder()
1786
1787    /**
1788     *  {@inheritDoc}
1789     */
1790    @Override
1791    public final String toString() { return m_CachedString.get(); }
1792}
